Kemenhub Monitor Hak Penumpang Sriwijaya yang Terdampak Pembatalan
07 Nov 2019, 22:49 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta - Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Udara Kementerian Perhubungan memastikan terpenuhinya keselamatan, keamanan dan kenyamanan calon pengguna jasa maskapai Sriwijaya Air, yang mengalami dampak pembatalan sejumlah rute penerbangan.
Direktur Jenderal Perhubungan Udara (Dirjen Hubud), Polana B Pramesti mengatakan berdasarkan informasi yang diperoleh pembatalan sejumlah rute tersebut merupakan imbas dari kondisi kerja sama yang kurang harmonis antara pihak PT Sriwijaya Air dengan PT Garuda Indonesia.
Dengan terhentinya sejumlah layanan, saat ini PT Sriwijaya Air masih mengoperasikan sebanyak 13 unit pesawat udara, dari 30
unit pesawat udara yang dimiliki.
Sisanya tidak dapat dioperasikan karena pesawat masih dalam masa periode perawatan, namun ada pula yang dinyatakan Aircarft On Ground (AOG), sebagai dampak dari penghentian layanan penyediaan suku cadang PT GMF AA.
"Saat ini seluruh inspektur penerbangan bidang angkutan udara dan inspektur penerbangan bidang kelaikudaraan dan pengoperasian pesawat udara, Kantor Otoritas Bandar Udara dan Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan udara telah melaksanakan kegiatan pengawasan dan monitoring terhadap pemenuhan aspek dan pelayanan penumpang PT Sriwijaya Air. Serta memastikan seluruh penumpang mendapatkan hak sesuai dengan ketentuan yang berlaku," ucap Polana dalam keterangan tertulis, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Adapun, sesuai dengan ketentuan penumpang dapat melakukan proses penjadwalan ulang kembali penerbangan, pengembalian biaya tiket. Serta apa bila keterlambatan penerbangan juga ditangani sesuai dengan ketentuan delay management, yang telah diatur sesuai dengan ketentuan Peraturan Menteri 89 tahun 2015, tentang penanganan keterlambatan penerbangan pada Badan Usaha Angkutan Udara Niaga berjadwal di Indonesia.

Ministry of Transportation Monitors Sriwijaya Passenger Rights Affected by Cancellation
Nov 7 2019, 22:49 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta - The Directorate General of Civil Aviation of the Ministry of Transportation ensures the fulfillment of the safety, security and comfort of prospective users of Sriwijaya Air airline services, which have experienced the effects of canceling a number of flight routes.
The Director General of Civil Aviation (Dirjen Hubud), Polana B Pramesti said that based on the information obtained by the cancellation of a number of these routes was the impact of the lack of harmonious cooperation between PT Sriwijaya Air and PT Garuda Indonesia.
With the cessation of a number of services, currently PT Sriwijaya Air still operates as many as 13 aircraft units, out of 30
aircraft units owned.
The rest cannot be operated because the aircraft is still in the maintenance period, but some are declared Aircarft On Ground (AOG), as a result of the cessation of the service of providing spare parts for PT GMF AA.
"At present all flight inspectors in the field of air transportation and flight inspectors in the field of airworthiness and aircraft operations, the Office of the Airport Authority and the Directorate General of Civil Aviation have carried out surveillance and monitoring activities to fulfill the aspects and services of PT Sriwijaya Air's passengers. in accordance with applicable regulations, "said Polana in a written statement, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Meanwhile, according to the provisions of the passenger can reschedule the flight back, refund the ticket costs. And what if flight delays are also handled in accordance with the provisions of delay management, which have been regulated in accordance with the provisions of Ministerial Regulation 89 of 2015, regarding handling flight delays at the scheduled Commercial Air Transport Business Entity in Indonesia.
